channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Open kitchen shelves may look great, Marni says, but are they for you?
item.description: I know it’s tempting. You see those clean, uncluttered open shelves in kitchens, with their matching ceramic dishes, beautifully staged glassware, lots of negative space, and you think, “Why not? If my kitchen had open shelving, my belongings would look great, too! Plus, everything would be so easy to reach.”

item.title: Marni's sentimental guide to giving the past a presence in our homes
item.description: Over the years, I have earned the reputation as the stuff police. I am forever nagging you to purge, declutter, toss, donate, edit, dump, oust, clear, lighten up and let go. But today, sit down, I am going to sentimentally suggest that some old things you should keep.

item.title: Doug Fernandes retires from Herald-Tribune after 37 years in sports
item.description: After a long career on the sidelines, in the press box, and locker rooms, Sarasota Herald-Tribune sports writer and columnist Doug Fernandes has put away his pen and notebook.

item.title: What are stablecoins and why are Visa and Mastercard so…
item.description: If you’ve never heard of stablecoins, you’re not alone. But if you’ve ever paid a bank fee, tapped your card at a checkout, or wondered why sending money takes days, then stablecoins matter to you. Quietly, they’re on the verge of disrupting how money moves, and the gatekeepers of today’s payment system, like Fiserv, Visa, and Mastercard, are watching with concern.

item.title: How Melania met future husband, father of Barron Trump…

item.title: Visit Sarasota County follows the seasons to market…
item.description: Every season brings a new reason to visit Sarasota. Anyone who has relocated to our area will tell you, often, it’s all about escaping the weather, exchanging snow shoveling with shell collecting. Other times, visitors are craving a reconnect with nature, be that on our white sands or along rivers out east.
